cda:ClinicalDocument.cda:title: Overall Plan of Care - HC Payor

cda:raceCode.codeSystemName: OMB Standards for Race and Ethnicity

cda:ethnicGroupCode.codeSystemName: OMB Standards for Race and Ethnicity

cda:section.cda:title: Disease Management Care Plan FOR ASTHMA

cda:item.cda:content: problem description: Member does not have an action plan for worsening symptoms and/or complications related to asthma.
date of onset: 09/16/2014
problem status: Open
problem assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
goal description: Member will understand/have an individualized action plan for worsening symptoms and/or complications related to asthma.
date established: 09/16/2014
goal assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
Review with the member how to contact health providers as needed to address issues and concerns regarding self-management
Encourage the member to share their asthma action plan with their caregiver/family for additional support/management of condition.
Healthwise Educational material - Your Action Plan
Healthwise Educational material - Checking Peak Flow
problem description: Member's asthma is not currently under control due to recurrent exacerbations requiring oral steroids
date of onset: 09/16/2014
problem status: Open
problem assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
goal description: Member no longer has recurrent exacerbations due to uncontrolled asthma
date established: 09/16/2014
goal assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
description:Discuss with the member on how to treat acute asthma symptoms with medications, review their purpose, and method of administration.
completed date:10/16/2014
performer:Care Manager, Pamela
Review with the member how to contact health providers as needed to address issues and concerns regarding self-management
Have the member explain their asthma triggers and keep a journal of triggers and events. Advise the member to share the journal with their provider.
Refer member to their health care provider for assessment and treatment of recurring exacerbations requiring oral steroids.
Instruct the member on how to use the peak flow zone system and how to find their personal best number. Discuss with the member the red, yellow, and green zone management.

cda:section.cda:title: Disease Management Care Plan FOR DIABETES

cda:item.cda:content: problem description: Potential for prediabetic diagnosis progressing to diabetes
date of onset: 01/01/2014
problem status: Open
problem assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
description:Review with the member lifestyle changes to improve their health status such as : diet, weight loss, and exercise
completed date:02/01/2014
performerCare Manager, Pamela
goal assigned:Care Manager, Pamela
goal description: Member gains knowledge and demonstrates ability to self-manage prediabetes; prediabetes remains controlled.
date established: 01/01/2014
goal assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
description:Provide member educational material on prediabetes and impact on life style
completed date:02/01/2014
performer:Care Manager, Pamela
Review with the member lifestyle changes to improve their health status such as : diet, weight loss, and exercise
Review and Discuss with the member the risk factors of prediabetes and potential progression to developing type 2 diabetes
problem description: Member is likely to have complications related to poor diet adherence.
date of onset: 12/23/2015
problem status: Pend
problem assigned: Page, Laurel
goal description: Member will demonstrate improved adherence to a diabetic diet as prescribed by provider
date established: 01/06/2016
goal assigned:
Educate the member on community resources for diabetic teaching/nutrition such as: www.diabetes.org
Send member educational information on a Diabetic diet plan and how it relates to the management of the Diabetic disease process
Refer the member to a dietician specializing in Diabetes for evaluation and recommendations
Discuss with the member on self-management of diet to improve health and minimize Diabetic disease progression and/or symptoms
problem description: Member experiences hyperglycemia with decreased physical activity impacting their diabetic self-management plan.
date of onset: 08/15/2014
problem status: Open
problem assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
goal description: Improve or maximize member's knowledge of diabetic self-management strategies as it relates to hyperglycemia and decreased physical activity.
date established: 08/15/2014
goal assigned: Care Manager, Pamela
Send the member educational materials on physical activity and how it relates to self-management of diabetes. Include examples of an activity tracker if needed.
Evaluate the member's current medications. If indicated consult with a pharmacist for assistance in evaluating drug interactions/dosages that could result in hyperglycemia.

Encourage member to maintain an activity journal that includes tracking blood sugar levels prior and after different physical activities. Encourage member to share their results with their healthcare providers.
Provide referrals to appropriate providers, including physical and occupational therapy for evaluation on exercise tolerance and development of an exercise plan
Assist the member in obtaining an appointment to their health care provider for evaluation and recommendations on a self-management diabetic exercise program
Address the members specific questions/concerns and provide education on how strenuous physical activity can impact their blood sugar levels
